MGAs, brokers and other participants in the insurance market have also benefitted from the use and distribution of white-labelled products. _Increasing reliance on technology_ Technology is playing an increasingly important role in all aspects of the insurance market. Significant investments are required by insurers and their distributors in order to ensure that customer service levels remain high, fraud is controlled, product design is fit-for-purpose and underwriting risk is managed. The use and analysis of data is critical to a successful insurance distribution chain. 126 -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Insurance market structure and size
Subsubsection Text: _UK non-life insurance market_ The UK non-life insurance market grew by 6.7% in 2022 to £71.1 billion and is forecasted to grow to £80.2 billion by 2027 according to Fitch Solutions. The global non-life insurance market grew at a CAGR of 5.7% from 2000 to 2022 and is valued at $4 trillion. The map below presents the global insurance market on the basis of real non-life premium. 124 ----- (1) Per Sigma Report 2023 by Swiss Re Institute. Represents total 2022 non-life premium volume. Numbers have been rounded to nearest $5 billion. Africa non-life premium volume as of 2021 due to data availability. (2) Per London Company Market Statistics Report 2023 by International Underwriting Association of London. Excludes UK/Ireland. _Source: Swiss Re Institute, International Underwriting Association of London International London market_ The international London market (the “London Market”) is the largest global center for commercial and specialty risk with an emphasis on high-exposure, complex risk. Key types of risk insured in the London Market include marine, aviation, catastrophe, professional indemnity and product liability. The London Market controlled more than $121 billion of gross written premium in 2020 consisting of $84 billion written directly by London and $37 billion marketed and controlled through London according to London Market Group.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: _On May 31, 2022, The Ardonagh Group Limited, the entity at which we previously reported our results, merged into the Group’s new indirect parent company, Tara Topco Limited. Following this merger, on June 1, 2022, AGHL acquired Ardonagh New Midco 3 Limited, including the Group companies that were previously owned by The Ardonagh Group Limited, and became the reporting entity for the Group. AGHL’s first reporting period included all transactions since its incorporation on December 8, 2021 to December 31, 2022. The nine-month period ended September 30, 2022, however, only includes four months of the results of operations and cash flows of the consolidated operations of AGHL due to the timing of the Tara Transactions. Accordingly, AGHL’s results during any period ended in 2022 are not comparable to any other period presented. We have accounted for the Tara Transactions using the acquisition method of accounting under IFRS 3, Business Combinations, applying purchase accounting adjustments that resulted, among others, in the recognition of intangibles (including goodwill) and deferred tax liabilities in our financial information. Due to the application of the acquisition method of accounting, the Unaudited Interim Financial Statements of AGHL are not directly comparable to the Audited Financial Statements of the Parent. See “Presentation of Financial Information—Differences in the Financial Statements of AGHL and the Parent.” To aid comparability between periods, the_ _following summary historical (i) consolidated statement of financial position as of December 31, 2022 and the consolidated statement of profit or loss and consolidated statement of cash flows for the year ended December 31, 2022 have been derived from the 2022 Audited Financial Statements of the Parent which have been prepared in accordance with IFRS and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum, (ii) consolidated statement of profit or loss and consolidated statement of cash flows for the year ended December 31, 2021 have been derived from the 2021 Audited Financial Statements of the Parent which have been prepared in accordance with IFRS and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum, (iii) consolidated statement of financial position as of December 31, 2021 have been derived from the comparative column in the 2022 Audited Financial Statements of the Parent, due to the restatement of trade and other receivables and retained losses, (iv) consolidated statement of financial position as of December 31, 2020 and the consolidated statement of profit or loss and consolidated statement of cash flows for the year ended December 30, 2020 have been derived from the comparative column in the 2021 Audited Financial Statements of the Parent and (v) consolidated statement of profit or loss, consolidated statement of financial position, and consolidated statement of cash flows as of and for the period ended September 30, 2022 and the nine months ended September 30, 2023 have been derived from the Unaudited Interim Financial Statements of AGHL which have been prepared in accordance with IAS 34 and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum. In addition, in September 2023, we announced the Retail Transaction. As a result of this merger and the resulting disposal of the Retail platform, in our Unaudited Interim Financial, we have presented Retail as held for sale on our consolidated statement of financial position as of September 30, 2023 and as a discontinued operation on our consolidated statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income for the nine months period ended September 30, 2023 and the period ended September 30, 2022. We have not restated or represented any other financial information as of or for any other period for the impact of the Retail Transaction. See “Summary—Recent Developments—Retail Transaction” and note 1 to the Unaudited Interim Financial Statements. Unless the context otherwise requires, all references herein to “we,” “our,” “us,” “Group” and “Ardonagh” with respect to any financial information in this offering memorandum are to (i) the Company and its consolidated subsidiaries for any period ended on or prior to December 31, 2022 and_ 95 ----- _(ii) AGHL and its consolidated subsidiaries for the period ended September 30, 2022 and any period after December 31, 2022. The following should be read in conjunction with “Presentation of Financial Information,” “Summary—Summary Historical Financial Information and Other Data” and the Financial Statements and the related notes thereto, which are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum. The information below is not necessarily indicative of our future results of operations. The following discussion contains forward-looking statements that reflect our plans and estimates and our beliefs. Our actual results could differ materially from those discussed in these forward-looking statements. Factors that could cause or contribute to these differences include, but are not limited to, those discussed below and elsewhere in this offering memorandum particularly in the sections entitled “Risk Factors” and “Forward-Looking Statements.”_

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Overview
Subsubsection Text: We are a highly diversified, leading independent insurance broker based in the UK operating at scale across numerous segments of the non-life insurance market in the UK and internationally. We provide a full range of non-life insurance products and related services across commercial, personal and wholesale insurance. As an insurance distribution intermediary, our business primarily consists of working with insurers to design, price, and administer insurance-related products and services, and as such, we do not assume any underwriting or principal risk. From our formation in 2017 to the end of 2023, we have increased our revenue (excluding Retail) by over three times and our Adjusted EBITDA (excluding Retail) by over five times, due to consistent strong organic growth and our proven acquisition strategy. The foundations laid over the past five years have provided a platform for further growth, which has positioned us, pro forma for all material acquisitions and disposals completed or committed as of November 2, 2023, as a top 10 independent insurance broker and a top 20 insurance broker globally according to Reinsurance News. In September 2023, we announced the merger and sale of our Retail Business to Markerstudy in a transaction valuing the business at £1.2 billion. See “Summary—Recent Developments—Retail Transaction.” For the twelve months ended September 30, 2023 and excluding Retail, we generated GWP of £12 billion, commissions and fees of £1.2 billion, Total Pro Forma Income of £1.6 billion, organic growth of 11.6%, Total Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA of £555.8 million and Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA margin of 33%. We offer a broad range of non-life insurance products in multiple geographies, ranging from higher value and lower volume bespoke corporate insurance products placed in the London Market, to SMB business insurance policies. Each aspect of our business is highly diversified with limited concentration or dependence on any single product, channel, carrier, income producer, or supplier. We combine this diversified operating model with a highly collaborative culture across the Group to provide our clients, carriers, and employees with a high-quality product and service offering. We serve a wide range of clients that include large MNCs, SMEs, individual consumers, and other third-party brokers and MGAs. We distribute our insurance products across multiple channels, including through a network of over 120 local offices in the United Kingdom and more than 150 offices worldwide, and online. Our global network provides the basis for deep, embedded local relationships and “trusted advisor” status with clients and benefits from long-standing trusted insurer partner relationships. We also maintain regional hubs to support our businesses through shared resources and expertise. Following the signing of the Retail Transaction, we have taken steps to organize our business into two main reporting segments, which we refer to as platforms, that focus on distinct but complementary aspects of the insurance brokerage and services value chain. See “Summary—Recent Developments— _Retail Transaction.”_ - **_Global P&C, which is our global broking platform with strong market positions across key geographies and is comprised of two subsegments: `o` _UK Advisory, an advice-led, community-focused set of businesses with an extensive local footprint of experts across sectors and specialisms with national and international reach, through which we provide a broad array of insurance broking products and advice on insurance, risk management and employee benefits to SMEs, large 127 ----- corporations and individual customers from our network of local offices in the United Kingdom. UK Advisory is one of the leading community-based broking and advisory platforms in the UK by revenue, driving growth through trusted relationships and local partnerships, and also includes an independent general insurance SME broker in the UK, a health, wellbeing and protection broker, complex claims specialists and one of the most widespread and well-developed networks of independent brokers in the UK. UK Advisory accounted for 36.7% of our Total Income Pro Forma for Completed Transactions for the twelve months ended September 30, 2023. `o` _International Advisory, which consists of our non-UK broking business and includes a growing portfolio of buy-and-build companies in attractive international markets, such as Ireland, Australia, the Netherlands, Greece, Switzerland, Austria, Portugal and Brazil. International Advisory accounted for 29.4% of our Total Income Pro Forma for Completed Transactions for the twelve months ended September 30, 2023. Global P&C generated organic growth of 10.6% in the twelve months ended September 30, 2023. - **_Specialty Broking, which is the largest independent specialty broker in the London market with global distribution and significant market position in key specialty lines. Specialty Broking combines expertise in specialist underwriting with the placing of bespoke global complex risks into Lloyd’s of London and the London Market. The platform also includes our specialist risk strategy and reinsurance broker, Inver Re, an important player in this space. Specialty Broking accounted for 34.0% of our Total Income Pro Forma for Completed Transactions and organic growth of 13.2% for the twelve months ended September 30, 2023. The following chart shows a breakdown of the key brands that we operate in each of our platforms. (1) Based on Total Pro Forma Income 128 -----

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strengths
Subsubsection Title: Leading global independent broker positioned in resilient insurance markets
Subsubsection Text: We are a highly diversified, leading, global independent insurance broker based in the United Kingdom. Following our creation in 2017 as the result of a combination of long-established leading insurance broking brands, we have rapidly grown into a top 20 global insurance broker by revenue. _ Source: A.M. Best Top 20 Global Brokers 2023 edition ranked by 2022 total revenue, company public information_ 4) Risk & Insurance business of Marsh only. 5) Pro forma for acquisition of Tiger Risk and Marsh R.S. 6) Pro forma for all material acquisitions and disposals completed or contractually committed as of November 2, 2023, and converted to U.S. dollars at an exchange rate of £1 to $1.22. We have a depth of specialist and local knowledge built-up over many years, and entrenched client relationships and deep community penetration. We believe that our scale and diversified proposition provides us with the ability to effectively compete with even our largest competitors and service over four million clients as a result of our broad industry knowledge and depth of understanding of customer needs from our team of over 8,000 professionals across more than 150 offices globally. The scale of premium we place in the market also allows us to capture incremental earnings across the insurance value chain and reduce costs. As a leading global independent insurance broker, we are well positioned to continue to benefit from the resilient and growing global non-life insurance market. The global non-life insurance market has proven highly resilient across cycles and recessions, and has been continually growing. The global nonlife market has experienced growth of approximately 3% per annum over the past twenty years, and has demonstrated resilience through a long track record of stable GWP growth with limited impact from past economic or capital market downturns as demonstrated by the below chart. 129 ----- _Source: Swiss Re Institute_ As compared to other sectors, our sector benefits from low volatility and proved to be one of the most resilient sectors through the COVID-19 pandemic. The growth in the industry is supported by favorable market dynamics. Brokers can, in middle market segments, promote strong client relations as a result of this low volatility and foster recurring revenue. We were able to maintain organic growth of approximately 3% from 2017 through 2020, and increased organic growth (excluding Retail) of 10.2%, 12.5% and 11.6% in 2021, 2022 and the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, respectively. We are regionally diversified, earning 34% of our GWPs for the twelve months ended September 30, 2023 (excluding the Retail Transaction) in the UK, 30% in North America, 15% in Europe, 10% in the APAC region, 8% in the LATAM region and 3% in the AMEA region, and our worldwide business is positioned at the center of global insurance markets as shown on the map below. 130 ----- Our global presence covers the major global insurance hubs and provides us with global access and insight. We established Ardonagh Global Partners in 2021 to invest in strong platforms operating in attractive markets and verticals outside the UK and Europe and to partner with management teams who want to grow faster as part of a larger group while retaining operational independence. Since its inception, Ardonagh Global Partners has grown to include Resilium, one of Australia’s largest independently-owned intermediary networks and the founding business of our Australia platform, and Ethos Broking Australia, which invests in or directly acquires brokers. Ardonagh Global Partners also includes Hemsley Wynne Furlonge, a specialist M&A warranty and indemnity insurance broker and advisor, MDS Group, an insurance broker and risk management advisor across the Portuguese-speaking world and Europe, the only Portuguese Lloyd’s Broker and the largest independent broker in Brazil, and Envest, an Australian-based insurance investment and distribution group, which now houses Australian assets Resilium and Epsilon Underwriting within the Group.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strengths
Subsubsection Title: Scaled platform with significant diversification across geographies and capabilities
Subsubsection Text: Our business is highly diversified across products, customers, channels, geographies and carriers. We offer a wide-ranging product portfolio across both general and bespoke insurance products and services across the insurance value chain, including personal and commercial lines, wholesale distribution, underwriting and insurance outsourcing services to large corporations, insurers, third-party brokers, SMEs, and individual consumers at a variety of price points, without assuming any underwriting or principal risk in relation to any of the services or products that we provide. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, no single line of business accounted for more than 20% of GWP. We reach customers through diverse distribution channels, including through our digital platform, telephone contact centers, and traditional face-to-face customer contact via our network of over 150 offices globally. As a result of our international presence, our GWP is diversified by geography, with 66% of our premium (excluding the Retail Transaction) placed outside the UK (specifically, 30% of our premium is placed in North America and 15% is placed in Europe). We have long-standing partnerships with key carriers, and relationships more broadly with a wide range of insurance carriers in each of the markets that we serve. Our large number of carrier relationships mitigates potential carrier concentration risks and enables us to enhance and improve our product offerings for clients as well as pricing and our own 131 ----- commercial terms. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, no single carrier accounted for more than 7% of our total GWP, with the top five carriers in aggregate representing less than 25% of total GWP. Our gross written premiums by geographical region, class of business and carrier are shown in the chart below: (2) LTM premiums to September 2023; pro forma to exclude Retail and include Assepro. Our highly diversified offering ensures minimal reliance on any particular product, distribution channel, customer, or market, limiting our exposure to any adverse industry developments and macroeconomic factors and thereby mitigating volatility in our overall financial performance. In addition, the breadth of our offering provides us with various avenues through which we can identify gaps in the market and develop specialized products to capture unmet demand. We are thus able take advantage of cross-selling opportunities to increase our customer penetration and drive incremental growth.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strengths
Subsubsection Title: Robust, accelerating organic growth benefitting from the realization of key strategic initiatives
Subsubsection Text: We have a track record of delivering strong organic income and margin growth. By leveraging our scaled platform and best practices, we have negotiated superior terms with insurer counterparties, industry participants, and suppliers, enabling us to offer a better experience and pricing to our customers. We also value diversity and keeping up with current technologic trends, prioritizing investments in people and data and technology. As a result, we have grown the business every quarter (compared with the prior year period) since our establishment in 2017 and have achieved double-digit organic growth since 2021, growing 10.2% in 2021, 12.5% in 2022 and 11.6% (excluding Retail) in the twelve months ended September 30, 2023. Our organic growth is driven, in part, by our key strategic initiatives across our segments, as outlined below. _Global P&C: UK Advisory_ - _Drive new business: Targeting large corporate clients with focused expertise and leveraging data and single customer view to cross-sell products within Advisory and between platforms - _Enhanced placement: Reducing the number of markets from 750 to 185 to improve client outcomes and reduce costs, giving partners white label access to existing binders and specialties, which allows them the opportunity to re-brand such binders and products, and leveraging increased scale to increase commission rates paid by customers across business - _Grow our digital proposition: Enhancing our online offering to improve the customer journey and reduce costs, and entering into affinity partner deals 132 ----- - _Integration:_ Focusing on integration through significant new opportunities for value creation with rapid integration of further “add-on” accretive acquisitions _Global P&C: International Advisory_ - _Identify strategic markets: Focusing on select regions that fulfill our acquisition criteria and clearly focus on larger, more sophisticated markets with growing macroeconomic conditions and a developed regulatory environment - _Utilize networks:_ Leveraging our networks and the wider broker networks to identify suitable assets and targeting attractive off-market opportunities at below market multiples - _Realize synergies:_ Rapidly integrating acquisitions to realize significant cost and revenue synergies - _Roll-out best practices: Establishing initiatives to accelerate organic growth and improve margin and cash flow conversion, and to provide access to new products and capacity _Specialty Broking_ - _Producer hires:_ Driving existing producer hires to maturity and hiring new individuals who can add value quickly with a relentless focus on renewal retention, leveraging existing retail and wholesale relationships - _Digital solutions:_ Leveraging and overlaying external tools to attract new business and protect existing business, employing digital solutions to get us closer to our end client - _Portfolio & Placement:_ Engaging with Ardonagh Portfolio Solutions (“APS”) for select lines such as terrorism, financial institution, personal injury and cyber in order to increase commissions, and actively managing portfolio to reduce exposure to underperforming lines - _Global strategy: Maximizing inflow from growing Global P&C platform, leveraging network memberships to increase existing business and inflow and capitalizing on footprint to drive further growth Our organic growth has been further supported over the past five years by delivering value from our new producer hires. We have generated Adjusted EBITDA of approximately £30 million for the twelve months ended September 30, 2023 from 29 maturing producer teams hired since 2020. Teams typically mature to their full profitability potential approximately three years after the expiry of capacity or covenant restriction. We have seven teams hired in 2020 that were at 75% maturity as of September 30, 2023, seven teams hired in 2021 at 58% maturity as of September 30, 2023, eight teams hired in 2022 at 37% maturity as of September 30, 2023 and six teams that started trading in the nine months ended September 30, 2023. As a result, we expect to realize additional Adjusted EBITDA as a result of these hires over the next three years.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strengths
Subsubsection Title: Proven ability to grow through thoughtful, highly accretive acquisitions and disciplined integration
Subsubsection Text: We have a long-term track record and well-established process for identifying, executing, and integrating highly accretive acquisitions across many geographies. We have completed or entered into acquisition agreements for more than 150 acquisitions since our establishment in 2017, which represents an enterprise value of over £3.2 billion with a year-to-date average “add-on” enterprise value multiple of 6.6 times and a “platform” enterprise value multiple of 9.6 times. We also have a further 36 acquisitions that are contractually committed or under signed letter of intent as of February 1, 2024, which would contribute an additional £32.2 million of Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA.This track record of successful acquisitions is shown in the below chart. 133 ----- 5) Reflects enterprise value of acquisitions completed in the relevant time period 6) Includes all material completed acquisitions 7) Reflects average EV / EBITDA multiple of “add-on” acquisitions from 2020 through Q3’23 8) Reflects average EV / EBITDA multiple of “platform” acquisitions from 2020 - Q3’23 We have built our Global P&C franchise by building on our UK Advisory business and carefully selected regional platforms. We have built our Specialty Broking business by investing in carefully strategic producer hires and specialisms. In the past three years, we have expanded our addressable markets through acquisitions in new synergistic geographies. In 2020, we acquired our first non-UK business, Arachas, Ireland’s largest commercial insurance broker, which kick-started our international operations. We have since established our latest standalone platform, International Advisory, under which we are consolidating our non-UK broking enterprises and related investments and under which we have launched our Ardonagh Europe and our Ardonagh Global Partners businesses. We established Ardonagh Global Partners in 2021 to invest in leading platforms operating in attractive markets and verticals outside the UK and Europe and to partner with management teams who want to grow faster as part of a larger group while retaining operational independence. Since its inception, Ardonagh Global Partners has grown to include various brands, including Resilium, one of Australia’s largest independently owned intermediary networks and the founding business of our Australian platform and Ethos Broking Australia, which invests in or directly acquires brokers. We continue to have a robust M&A pipeline, and we continue to explore larger transaction opportunities both in the UK and internationally with a strong focus on market-leading platforms in our international business. To successfully complete and integrate such a large amount of acquisitions, we follow a clear, disciplined and highly selective acquisition strategy. We encourage competition between segments in order to receive centrally controlled capital for acquisitions, and we employ a rigorous due diligence process that is implemented by our highly experienced and dedicated team of investment professionals. Given the scope of our operational footprint, we are also able to leverage deep local knowledge in our markets in order to further understand our targets. Our primary focus when reviewing potential opportunities is on the customer proposition and financial returns. We have also implemented a robust and efficient integration and post-deal tracking process after closing. 134 ----- Our disciplined execution focuses on a clear, orderly and highly selective strategy based on ten principles: strategic fit, cultural fit, integration commitment, aligned incentives, financial returns, synergy discipline, cash discipline, realistic plan, risk assessment and clear accountability. We perform a rigorous due diligence process through a highly experienced and dedicated team of investment professionals, leveraging deep local knowledge in the markets where we operate and a robust and efficient integration and post-deal tracking process. We are able to present ourselves as the acquirer of choice by emphasizing our culture, aligning interests and maintaining discipline. In addition, we have made significant investments in our technology platform, which allows us to integrate new acquisitions at low cost and with low integration risk.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strengths
Subsubsection Title: Leading data and analytics capabilities driving platform efficiencies
Subsubsection Text: Our leading centralized data and analytics capabilities allow us to enhance risk solutions for capacity providers and improve outcomes for our clients and to drive cost savings. These capabilities have been primarily utilized to support the building of broker facilities, which then allow us to access predominantly traditional capacity in more efficient ways for the client. For example, we have used data and analytics to significantly improve and re-package older previous products into better terms, cover and product for our clients, including improvements on the Terrorism, Fine Art Jewellery and Specie facilities. We have also used data and analytics to introduce brand new facilities to the market, such as a Construction facility and a cross-class facility named LECTIO. The following chart shows our centralized data analytics structure, where we have centralized global premium and carrier information using our data center based in Mullingar, Ireland. As an example, in our Specialty Broking platform, we have built facilities such as the Ardonagh Portfolio Solutions (“APS”) business to use data analytics and capabilities to bring benefits to both clients, in terms of wider market placement, and our Group, in terms of increased revenues. Our technology and scale facilities have also allowed us to identify cost savings totalling approximately £15.8 million that we expect to achieve within the next 12 months. In our Global P&C: UK Advisory segment, we expect cost savings of £3.2 million, primarily as a result of a target model implementation project that has reduced headcount through efficiency gains from optimizing policy administration systems, an IT transformation from improving the office network, which is aimed at removing legacy applications and outsourcing, and an onshoring finance project expected to deliver benefits from process efficiencies and automation. In our Global P&C: International Advisory segment, we expect cost savings of £3.9 million from synergies through our hub-and-spoke model and by integrating further 135 ----- acquisitions into our existing platforms. In our Specialty Broking segment, we expect cost savings of £8.2 million from a technology-led transformation of middle- and back-office functions. We have also identified cost synergies in connection with the acquisition of Corant Global, including harmonization of reward structures, footprint consolidation and back-office optimization, and the acquisition of the Oxford Insurance Group. We have also identified cost savings of £0.5 million through back-office optimization in our Corporate function.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strengths
Subsubsection Title: Attractive financial profile with strong growth, profitability and cash flow conversion
Subsubsection Text: Since our establishment in 2017, we have delivered a transformational improvement in our quality of earnings and have had strong performance across all metrics. We experienced a four times increase in revenue (including Retail) from 2017 to Total Pro Forma Income (excluding Retail) in the twelve months ended September 30, 2023 and a seven times increase in Adjusted EBITDA (including Retail) to Total Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA (excluding Retail) during the same period. We also experienced a more than eight percentage points increase in organic growth from 2017 to the twelve months ended September 30, 2023 (excluding Retail) and a more than 13 percentage point increase in Adjusted EBITDA margin over the same time period (excluding Retail). We have designed our business model to generate high EBITDA margins with limited working capital and maintenance capital expenditure requirements, resulting in management operating cash flow of £420 million and an operating cash conversion of 86% in the twelve months ended September 30, 2023. Since our establishment, we have delivered a transformational improvement in quality of earnings, primarily as a result of significant investments towards transformative cost-savings programs and synergy initiatives in our business to create a scalable and efficient platform that is conducive to future growth, resulting in approximately £150 million of realized cost-savings since the start of 2018. Our investments have resulted in a continued and rapid improvement in our quality of earnings as cost savings are delivered and one-time costs have decreased. We believe that our cash generative business model is highly scalable and that we will be able to leverage our well-invested infrastructure as we continue to grow organically and via acquisitions. (4) Includes reported EBITDA and the following adjustments: acquisitions and financing costs, gains on revaluation of associate and investment, profit on disposal of business, pro forma impact of completed transactions and pro forma for transactions under LOI. Total Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA also includes an adjustment for organic growth in Q4 2023. See “Summary Historical Financial _Information and Other Data—Other Consolidated and Pro Forma Data.”_ 136 ----- (5) Includes the following adjustments: business transformation and legacy costs, other costs and regulatory costs. (6) Reflects Total Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA. See “Summary Historical Financial Information and Other Data—Other _Consolidated and Pro Forma Data.”_ Our transformational improvement in quality of earnings has improved cash generation. In the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, we had management operating cash flow of £420 million and an operating cash conversion of 86% in the twelve months ended September 30, 2023. We believe that our cash generative business model is highly scalable and that we will be able to leverage our well-invested infrastructure as we continue to grow organically and via acquisitions. The continuing contribution from new producer hires already made but not yet at maturity and from enhanced and alternative capacity arrangements in place to better serve our existing customers also supports our cash generation.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strengths
Subsubsection Title: Deep, aligned management team well positioned to drive culture and lead ongoing growth
Subsubsection Text: Our management team is highly experienced in leading and growing successful insurance intermediary organizations. Our Chief Executive Officer, David Ross, has over 25 years of industry experience building and leading brokerage businesses including leading transformative mergers and acquisitions in the insurance intermediary field. Mr. Ross is supported by a highly experienced management team with over 25 years of industry experience on average, with a strong track record of delivering on transformative change and investment. Our Chief Financial Officer, Diane Cougill, has over 20 years of industry experience and has held senior leadership positions at RAC and at Aviva. Our senior management team also includes Aurelio Cusaro, our Chief Investment Officer, John Tiner, our Chairman, Geoff Gouriet, our General Counsel, and Sarah Dalgarno, our Chief Risk Officer. Our Global P&C senior management includes Rob Worrell, Chief Executive Officer of our UK Advisory segment, Conor Brennan, Chairman of our International Advisory segment and Des O’Connor, Chief Investment Officer of our International Advisory segment. Our Specialty Broking senior management includes Chief Executive Officer Andrew Wallin and Chairman James Masterson. Together, this team leads a deep bench of revenue-producing talent and committed operational support staff, all of whom have been specifically targeted for their entrepreneurial spirit and ability to drive sustainable revenue growth. The culture cultivated by our senior management team leads to our continued success in the insurance market and differentiates itself from other competitors in various ways, including: - An emphasis on entrepreneurship at a local level with strong organizational alignment, resulting in colleagues working together towards common, Group-wide objectives, - Continuous cross-group collaboration to amplify the best of our collective experience and insight, - The application of the depth and breadth of our specialist expertise, built through years of market leadership, - Our tailored and innovative solutions and ability to understand what works for each industry, market and client, - Our deep relationships with clients built through longstanding service, accountability and trust, and - Our regular programming to celebrate special accomplishments and promote internal events. These factors have resulted in over 90% client retention based on strong relationships, knowledge and expertise, stickiness of specialist products and high barriers to entry, and 95% average producer retention across last five years (excluding non-regrettable leavers), as a result of our ability to leverage a broader platform, our emphasis on training, development and support, our aligned incentives with producers and our collaborative and cohesive culture. 137 ----- Management and employees are incentivized directly or indirectly through a combination of B ordinary share ownership at Tara Topco Limited and/or participation in various broad equity and performance schemes, the value of which are linked to the achievement of long term, sustainable, and profitable growth. We also benefit from the support, significant investment experience and industry network in the insurance broking and underwriting market of our long-term majority shareholders, HPS Investment Partners and Madison Dearborn Partners, who in aggregate directly or indirectly own over 90% of our equity capital. HPS Investment Partners and Madison Dearborn Partners have been highly supportive of our management and have demonstrated their continued commitment to Ardonagh by investing $2.7 billion in common equity over the past years.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strategies
Subsubsection Title: Accelerate organic growth by optimizing placement strategy and driving new business through new products, cross-selling and up-selling
Subsubsection Text: We seek to consistently achieve double-digit organic growth across our overall business by expanding product portfolios, streamlining operations, increasing penetration of our customer base—particularly in new synergistic geographies—through concerted sales efforts across our Group and capitalizing on a targeted acquisitions pipeline. We have a growing pipeline of new specialist products that is highly complementary to our existing offerings, including high net worth, political violence, specialty terrorism facility. These products are being developed on existing systems and channels at limited upfront cost and are largely linked to new hires, who can contribute the relevant product and channel expertise. As an example, new products launched in our Specialty Broking platform contributed towards organic growth of approximately 11.6% in the twelve months ended September 30, 2023. As part of our organic growth strategy, we are also focused on cross-selling and up-selling and customer retention and expansion. We seek to improve cross-selling and up-selling across Group clients, including by leveraging data. We have rolled out of a Group-wide database in which we collate data from each of our platforms to enable a “single view of the client” (i.e., how many policies are linked to each client across personal and commercial lines) to facilitate retention, cross-selling and up-selling. This database continues to provide a more granular understanding of our clients’ needs, allowing us to offer them tailored cross-selling opportunities. We have also implemented a bespoke pricing system and leveraged our data infrastructure, fraud detection capabilities and access to third-party data sources to improve retention and increase customer lifetime value across most products. In our Specialty Broking platform, we have developed a highly sophisticated customer and broker-facing software which interfaces with several market-leading policy administrative systems and substantially improves ease of access to customer and broker data. We are also in discussions with several third-party brokers who are clients of our wholesale platform to roll-out this software in order to maximize efficiency and centralization within our platform and improve the experience of third-party brokers on our platform. We also intend to leverage our membership of the Worldwide Broker Network to increase existing business and in-flow through the establishment of new relationships and intend to capitalize on our existing global footprint to drive further growth. In the UK, our UK Advisory business launched a focused client strategy aimed at large UK corporates, which is already bearing fruit with the successful signing of several marquee clients, including a global broadcaster that has a £5 billion turnover and also the UK’s largest charity. In addition, in 2021, we launched Inver Re, a new risk strategy and reinsurance broker with ambitions to harness our scale, resources and reach to offer a credible alternative to global brokers and become our industry’s independent reinsurance broker of choice. We plan to further strengthen our reinsurance operations by (i) consolidating our existing reinsurance operations while organically building out our brand, talent and capabilities in key global hubs (such as London, North America & Bermuda), (ii) developing our first party business through leveraging key group carrier relationships, (iii) hiring industry leading talent and building further revenue streams and (iv) deploying M&A to expand geographic focus beyond key hubs (such as in Latin America and Asia). 138 -----

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strategies
Subsubsection Title: Streamline operations through our continued focus on capacity excellence, talent excellence and operational excellence
Subsubsection Text: We are constantly re-examining our operating models to incrementally streamline lower value-add operations and further support our front-office distribution and client service capabilities. We have developed a range of strategies to streamline operations and optimize middle and back-office functions. Our strategy is based on three key pillars of excellence, which are: - _Capacity excellence. We seek to reach capacity excellence by operating a strategic capacity model through our Ardonagh Portfolio Solutions (“APS”) business, part of our Specialty Broking platform. APS utilizes data captured from across the Group’s platforms and businesses to enhance income through a centralized placement. We expect our APS business to be a key growth driver going forward by allowing us to capitalize on a select number of strategic carrier relationships, create market leading products which offer better terms for our customers and access alternative capital providers either directly or in connection with our MGA business. We intend to engage with APS for select high-profitability lines and actively manage the portfolio to reduce exposure to underperforming lines. - _Talent excellence. We believe that we will be able to deliver significant incremental income and EBITDA growth by nurturing talent excellence. We are working to attract the best people in our industry and are ideally placed to capitalize on market dislocation. We believe that incoming hires bring capabilities and are highly accretive. We have a strong track record of income hires and producer recruitment, delivering significant incremental income and EBITDA. We intend to leverage our success to date to continue selective transformational hires, focusing on hiring exceptional individuals who can swiftly add value to our Group. Since 2019, we have secured at least five new specialist team hires per year, and currently have a deep pipeline of future hires. We also intend to deliver on exceptional existing hires, relentlessly focusing on renewal retention, leveraging existing retail and wholesale relationships. - _Operational excellence. We believe that through operational excellence we can continue our track record of delivering value through our focus on operational expertise. We have delivered cost efficiencies to drive margin expansion across all divisions, resulting in approximately £150 million of synergies and cost savings delivered to date since the start of 2018, and £15.8 million of cost savings and cost synergies expected to be delivered within the next twelve months, consisting of (i) £3.2 million within the UK Advisory platform resulting from benefits from a target operating model implementation project that has reduced headcount through efficiency gains from optimizing policy administration systems, IT transformations from improving the office network, removing legacy applications and outsourcing and an onshoring finance project expected to deliver benefits from process efficiencies and automation, (ii) £8.2 million within the Specialty Broking platform resulting from the technology-led transformation of our middle and back office functions and the cost synergies identified with the acquisition of Corant Global, including the harmonization of reward structures, footprint consolidation and backoffice optimization, as well as the acquisition of Oxford Insurance, (iii) £3.9 million within the International Advisory platform through the ‘hub and spoke’ model and the integration of further acquisitions into existing platforms and (iv) £0.5 million through back-office optimization in our Corporate segment. We also continue to make significant investments into our technology platform, as we believe that digital solutions will get us closer to our end client, allowing us to leverage and overlay external tools to attract new business and protect existing business.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strategies
Subsubsection Title: Expand our addressable markets in new synergistic geographies
Subsubsection Text: We intend to continue expanding our addressable markets in synergistic geographies. In 2021 we established our International Advisory platform, under which we are consolidating our non-UK broking 139 ----- enterprises and related investments and under which we have launched our Ardonagh Europe and our Ardonagh Global Partners businesses. We established Ardonagh Global Partners in 2021 to invest in leading platforms operating in attractive markets and verticals outside the UK and Europe and to partner with management teams who want to grow faster as part of a larger group while retaining operational independence. We intend to continue growing our International Advisory platform with the aim of consolidating our presence in a selected portfolio of fast-growing markets and expanding participation in select new products and markets where there is significant synergy between our UK platforms and our International Advisory platform. We are focusing on a number of regions which fulfil our acquisition criteria, and intend to employ the hub and spoke methodology to quickly expand our regional presence. Our aim is to develop a number of regional hubs, with specialist knowledge, technology and product expertise, to support in-country assets, and we intend to focus on strategic markets with assets that are capable of executing further in-country expansion.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Strategies
Subsubsection Title: Continue to grow by capitalizing on targeted acquisitions pipeline
Subsubsection Text: As part of our strategy, we target additional growth expected from accretive acquisitions, and intend to further strengthen our position and broaden our portfolio by continuing to consolidate smaller players in the highly fragmented and competitive UK and international insurance markets. Any acquisition we pursue will be in line with our targeted and selective acquisition criteria focused on companies with attractive profitability, growth potential and complementary business operations. We utilize our network to identify suitable targets at reasonable multiples. We support acquired assets post-acquisition in order to achieve our organic growth plans going forward, utilizing our expertise and networks. We also manage the realization of identified revenue and cost synergies on an ongoing basis. We have a highly disciplined and proven acquisition program, which includes a standardized approach to integration and synergy delivery, which, together with the proven execution ability of our management team and our strong focus on value creation and financial metrics, allows us to maximize synergies and rapidly deploy economies of scale to acquired businesses. We have a robust M&A pipeline underpinned by a rigorous evaluation and assessment process driven by an experienced and dedicated team of M&A professionals, and we continue to explore larger transaction opportunities both in the UK and internationally with a strong focus on market-leading platforms in our international business. Acquisitions completed during the fourth quarter of 2023 (including the impact of the AccuRisk disposal) contributed Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA of £13.6 million for the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, and acquisitions completed between January 1, 2024 and February 1, 2024 contributed an additional £3.0 million. We have a further 36 acquisitions that are contractually committed or under signed letter of intent as of February 1, 2024, which would contribute an additional £32.2 million of Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA. Our pipeline includes targets on multiple continents. We are also actively pursuing other acquisitions in the near-term or very nearterm, including one or more potentially material acquisitions.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: History
Subsubsection Text: We were established in 2017 through the combination of several insurance services providers into a single multi-product and multi-channel platform led by a highly experienced senior management team with the aim of fostering innovation in the insurance market. Since our establishment, we have continued to grow through a combination of a sustained focus on organic growth, operational excellence and a highly disciplined expense strategy, and acquisition program, which includes a standardized approach to integration and synergy delivery, and which we believe allows us to maximize synergies and rapidly deploy economies of scale to acquired businesses. Our business strategy has followed a three phased strategy. During our first phase, from founding in 2017 until 2019, our focus was primarily on establishing scale and making our UK businesses key competitors in their segments, specifically our Retail business containing our UK personal lines business and our Specialty Broking business containing our London markets wholesale business, and 140 ----- adding niche and specialist lines to our commercial and SME business to create the UK Advisory business. Our strategy was to integrate acquisitions and streamline the operations through centralized, in-country IT and data, carrier placements and back office functions. During our second phase, between 2019 and 2022, we shifted our focus to broader international expansion, acquiring businesses with the aim to diversify and expand our footprint while continuing to focus on operational excellence, with the aim of improving margins in our UK markets. With the integration of acquisitions and our disciplined approach to operational excellence, we have delivered approximately £150 million of synergies and cost savings since the start of 2018. In the third phase of our strategy, beginning in 2023, our focus has been to release capital unlocked by the Retail Transaction to invest in our higher organic growth Global P&C and Specialty Broking platforms, predominantly in international markets. See “—Retail—Retail _Transaction” below. The chart below shows the evolution of our main segments over the past three_ years. Since 2017, we have completed more than 150 acquisitions, and in 2023 alone we completed 67 acquisitions. Our major acquisitions since mid-2020 include, among others: - Arachas, a commercial insurance broker in Ireland, in 2020; - Bravo, which comprises Broker Network and Compass, two established network service providers to regional insurance brokers and Ethos Broking, a highly active acquisition platform focused on the UK regional insurance market, in 2020; - Resilium Pty Limited, the founding business of our Australian platform, in February 2021; - Hemsley Wynne Furlong LLP, a specialist M&A warranty and indemnity insurance broker and advisor, in March 2021; - Usay Group Limited, one of the largest consumer personal medical insurance and protection insurance brokers in the UK, in September 2021; - the Hooper Dolan companies, a client-focused general insurance broker with offices across Ireland, in October 2021; - the insurance operations of BGC Partners Inc., a leading global brokerage and financial technology company, in November 2021; - the Léons Group, a family-owned independent insurance brokerage and consultancy firm based in the Netherlands, in October 2022; - Glennon Insurances, a leading provider of insurance solutions in Ireland, in December 2022; 141 ----- - the MDS Group, an insurance broker and risk management advisor primarily based in Portugal and Brazil, with offices in Angola, Mozambique, Spain, Switzerland and Malta, in December 2022; - Envest PTY Limited, an Australian insurance investment and distribution group, in February 2023; - the Oxford Insurance Group, a Lloyd’s broker with further operations in Switzerland, Liechtenstein and Dubai, in March 2023; - the SRS Group, an Athens-based group whose businesses include a independent wholesale reinsurance broker and a managing general agencies (“MGA”) platform, in June 2023; - Klap Verzekeringsmakelaar, a Dutch specialist commercial lines insurance broker, in June 2023; - Classicus, a high-net-worth broker headquartered in the Netherlands, in August 2023; and - ASSEPRO, one of the largest independent commercial brokers for small and medium-sized enterprises in Switzerland, with additional operations in Austria and Liechtenstein, in November 2023. Our Group’s customers span from individuals to global corporations through our rapidly growing international presence. The chart below illustrates how we connect customers to insurance capacity across our full scope of products and services:

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Our Business
Subsubsection Text: The Global P&C platform, comprised of the UK Advisory and International Advisory platforms, is a global broking platform mainly focused on SME and mid-corporate clients with strong market positions across key geographies. The platform has a global network of more than 100 locations, which provides for deeply embedded local and “trusted advisor” status with clients. Global P&C offers a broad product set and maintains a highly active M&A strategy with a significant global pipeline of accretive bolt-ons. _UK Advisory_ The UK Advisory platform provides a broad range of insurance broking products and advice on insurance, risk management and employee benefits to SMEs, large corporations and individual customers. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, UK Advisory generated £512.6 million of Total Pro Forma Income and £162.6 million of Total Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA. As part of UK Advisory, we offer tailored insurance broking services to our clients via in-person, telephony, and online communications, providing them with a broad range of choices and access to specialist products and solutions designed to meet individual needs across the full spectrum of commercial, corporate and personal classes. The primary lines of coverage in our UK Advisory platform include motor fleet, commercial, property, liability, professional indemnity, and contractors. We also provide standard non-specialist insurance products tailored to specific sectors or risks that may be more difficult to place elsewhere in the insurance market. UK Advisory maintains a strong community focus through our network of over 120 offices across the United Kingdom. SME insurance intermediary products require industry and customer expertise to develop and market effectively, and we believe that SME customers value direct relationship management and advisory services when purchasing such specialized products, which we are able to provide via our local office network. UK Advisory operates through seven community-focused brands: - Towergate Insurance Brokers: one of the UK’s leading independent insurance brokers and risk management advisors providing commercial and specialist lines insurance to clients all over the UK; - Towergate Health & Protect: health, protection and employee benefits; - Riskline: specialist, micro-SME focused proposition; - Footman James: specialist classic car brand with a high-net-worth client base; - Usay: consumer private medical insurance (“PMI”) and protection; - Ethos Broking: regional niche and specialist broking; and - Bravo Network: contains two of the largest networks of independent regional brokers in the UK – Broker Network and Compass – providing insurance broking to SME businesses in the UK. 143 ----- Towergate Insurance Brokers and Towergate Health and Protection products are sold mainly through face-to-face relationships via the Towergate brand. Riskline is a center of excellence selling to microSMEs over the phone and online. Footman James is an established brand in the classic car insurance sector (within the wider private motor insurance market) selling directly to consumers and, as such, aligns to our broader high-net-worth proposition across our UK Advisory platform as a whole. Ethos Broking and Bravo Networks provide insurance broking and member services with an SME focus via community broking offices and a network presence. Additionally, Towergate Insurance Brokers is a member of the Worldwide Broker Network, and can as such collaborate with other independent brokers worldwide to deliver cross-border insurance programs. UK Advisory is an established M&A powerhouse with a track record of successfully implementing its acquisition strategy. Since June 2020, UK Advisory has completed 28 acquisitions, including: Bravo, Guy Penn, Sennet, Headley, AFL Retail, Chambers & Newman, Hera, Drayton Insurance, Murton Alexander, Thompson & Bryan, Schofields, USAY, Lorega, Stallard Kane Group, The Professional Indemnity Company, PB Curran, Sentinel Insurance Solutions Limited, AMS Insurance Solutions, Sorvio Insurance Brokers Limited and RiskSTOP Group. We also have a significant pipeline of potential, accretive bolt-on acquisitions, including through our hub-and-spoke consolidation platform, Ethos, and Bravo Network, which comprises Broker Network and Compass, two established network service providers to regional insurance brokers with approximately 615 members that provide a pool to identify and execute accretive acquisitions. _International Advisory_ The International Advisory platform consists of our non-UK broking enterprises. International Advisory focuses on leveraging our existing scale, assets and wholesale market access to increase overall value. We aim to develop regional hubs through hub-and-spoke methodology to build in-country assets and support their rapid expansion through shared resources and expertise. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, International Advisory generated £516.5 million of Total Pro Forma Income and £201.1 million of Total Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA. Our largest business in our International Advisory platform is based in Ireland and trades under our Arachas brand. Arachas, an Irish SME-focused commercial insurance broker with specialized offerings and a nationwide reach, has quickly gained a leading position in its core markets. Arachas has grown rapidly through a combination of strong organic growth and targeted acquisition of synergistic businesses, including O’Driscoll O’Neil DAC in 2020, Hooper Dolan and BJP Insurance Brokers in 2021 and Glennon Insurances in 2022. Other continental European businesses include Klap, Leon and Classicus in the Netherlands and ASSEPRO, acquired in late 2023, which trades in Austria and Switzerland. In 2021, we focused on investing in markets and verticals outside the UK and Europe and partnering with management teams who want to grow faster as part of a larger group while retaining operational independence. This included our acquisition of Resilium, a large, independently owned intermediary network in Australia and Ethos Broking Australia, which invests in or directly acquires brokers. In December 2022, we acquired the MDS Group, an insurance broker and risk management advisor across the Portuguese-speaking world and Europe, the only Portuguese Lloyd’s Broker and the largest independent broker in Brazil, and in February 2023 we acquired Envest, an Australian-based insurance investment and distribution group, which now houses Australian assets Resilium and Epsilon Underwriting within the Group.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Our Business
Subsubsection Text: The Specialty Broking platform combines expertise in specialist underwriting with the placing of bespoke complex risk products for large UK and international corporate clients. Specialty Broking operates through globally recognized heritage brands, including Price Forbes, Bishopsgate, Ed Broking, 144 ----- Inver Re, Piiq Risk Partners, and Robus. Specialty Broking is London headquartered and in close proximity to Lloyd’s of London and the London market, sourcing business from over 180 countries worldwide. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, Specialty Broking generated £535.1 million of Total Pro Forma Income and £193.4 million of Total Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA. Through our Lloyd’s of London brokerage business, which is one of the largest independent wholesale broker in the London market with offices around the globe, we provide UK and international corporate clients with open market programs, reinsurance and international solutions designed to empower clients to achieve their strategic ambitions. Price Forbes, one of the world’s oldest specialty insurance brands, and Bishopsgate provide UK and international corporate clients with access to specialist sector insurance products covering a wide range of markets, including energy, North American property, marine, power, aviation, specie (covering high-value, portable items such as gemstones and bullion), cargo, mining and terrorism. Since June 2020, we completed the acquisitions of Robus and Rural Insurance, and in 2021, we acquired the insurance operations of BGC Partners Inc., a leading global brokerage and financial technology company. Most recently, in 2023, we acquired Lloyd’s broker Oxford Insurance Group, which operates across several specialist sectors including professional indemnity, property, general liability, marine and energy, strengthening the growth potential of our Specialty Broking platform. The Specialty Broking platform also includes our Ardonagh Portfolio Solutions (“APS”) business, which leverages the scale of the Group and optimizes our product development and capacity placement strategy. APS is built on data captured from across Group’s platforms and businesses, creating connectivity between segments and developing a “single view” of clients. APS centrally co-ordinates the most appropriate placement of premiums to drive better solutions for our clients and capital providers, enabling us to further monetize our scale. This includes the development of a number of market-leading facilities across the terrorism and professional indemnity classes. These facilities improve terms, pricing and quality of service to customers, consolidate multiple markets and carriers and utilize the size, scale and diversification of a portfolio of risks.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Our Business
Subsubsection Text: The Retail platform operates as a digitally focused broker with price comparison websites (“PCW”) and direct channels, offering a range of specialized home, car, and specialist products such as bike (including products focused on particular customer categories or risk types within these segments such as caravan or van insurance) insurance products to individuals and small businesses via a portfolio of leading brands and leveraging on our back-office scale. Retail utilizes a data-led distribution strategy focused on online channels, including PCW, complemented by traditional call center support, as well as through third party intermediaries consisting of mainly independent financial advisors and mortgage brokers. As part of the Retail platform we operate several retail-facing insurance brands, including Autonet Insurance Group, Carole Nash, Paymentshield, Marmalade, Swinton Group, Lloyd Latchford Group, Healthy Pets and Be Wiser Insurance. In September 2023, we announced the merger and disposal of the Retail platform with the Markerstudy Group, with our shareholders maintaining a stake in the combined business. The transaction values Atlanta at £1.2 billion. The Retail Transaction is subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals. As a result of this merger and the resulting disposal of the Retail platform, in our Unaudited Interim Financial Statements we have presented Retail as held for sale on our consolidated statement of financial position as of September 30, 2023 and as a discontinued operation on our consolidated statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income for the nine months period ended September 30, 2023 and the period ended September 30, 2022. See “Summary—Recent Developments—Retail _Transaction.”_ 145 -----

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Our Business
Subsubsection Text: We maintain a non-operating segment comprising central costs and income not allocated to our reporting segments. These costs include Group board costs and Group function costs, including certain legal and regulatory expenses. Income in this non-operating segment primarily relates to interest income. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2023, Corporate generated £28.8 million of Total Pro Forma Income and £1.8 million of Total Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Our Business
Subsubsection Text: Following the announcement of the Retail Transaction, our business has been organized into two main reporting segments, which we refer to as platforms, that focus on distinct but complementary aspects of the insurance brokerage and services value chain. Global P&C (which is comprised of UK Advisory and International Advisory) and Specialty Broking. We also currently own a Retail segment, which houses several digitally focused personal lines brands which offer home, motor and pet insurance alongside a range of specialist personal and small business 142 ----- insurance products. In September 2023, we announced the Retail Transaction, following which Retail will no longer be part of the Group. See “—Retail—Retail Transaction” below. In addition, we maintain a non-operating Corporate segment comprising central costs and income (primarily interest income) not allocated to our reporting segments.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Information Technology
Subsubsection Text: We make significant investments into our technology platform to make it scalable and resilient. We have retained specialist IT services provider Mphasis to deliver tailored infrastructure services across various parts of The Ardonagh Group and are in the process of transitioning to cloud-based data centers and a cloud-based core finance platform, which we believe will contribute to ongoing operating efficiencies across our businesses. We also utilize Microsoft’s Azure cloud platform across several applications. Our business benefits from what we believe to be a market leading and scalable technology platform that can be leveraged across The Ardonagh Group, allowing us to process data more securely, with lower error rates and at lower cost. Investments into our technology platform have also made it easier to integrate new acquisitions at low cost and with low integration risk. Such technical capabilities have also made us an attractive partner to third parties operating in our industry. The following chart shows our centralized data analytics structure, under which we have centralized global premium and carrier information using our data center based in Mullingar, Ireland: We assign high priority to cyber security and have appointed a Chief Information Security Officer (the “CISO”), who is supported in their activities by a dedicated information security team. The CISO’s team is an independent risk and control team which ensures that our divisions maintain our desired information security standards. As a result of our cyber security precautions, we have been able to obtain insurance that provides coverage in the event of a cyber-attack.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Intellectual Property
Subsubsection Text: We believe each of our underlying businesses’ trademarks and major service and product brands enhance our competitive advantage and are essential to our business. Our businesses, in particular those that are customer-facing and those with historic name recognition, have developed brand named products and entities that we believe help attract and retain our customer base. We actively take steps 146 ----- to protect our intellectual property rights when and where we deem appropriate by relying on copyright and trademark laws, confidentiality procedures and contractual provisions. Many of our businesses maintain their own trademarks and certain of our businesses market their products under a variety of trademarks or brands. We have registered internet domain names, which are either used by our businesses to deliver services and information to our customers or held to protect trading names and brands that we develop. Although we have contributed to the development of certain of the software platforms that we license, the proprietary rights in the intellectual property of these software platforms generally rests with the licensors. We presently have no patents or patent applications pending.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (“ESG”)
Subsubsection Text: Under the Integrity pillar, we are committed to upholding the highest ethical standards among our executives, employees and business partners while addressing compliance and ethics risks related to our business. It is our aim to ultimately cover strategies for ESG risk mitigation, business ethics, management of the regulatory environment, critical incident risk management and systemic risk management. Our primary policy for promoting integrity remains the Ardonagh Group Code of Conduct. We also operate a dedicated, Group-wide Anti-Money Laundering and Anti-Bribery and Corruption Program. This program includes due diligence on suppliers and vendors, annual training for all personnel, requisite compliance declarations from all associated persons and comprehensive whistleblowing arrangements. We have also become a signatory in support of the four principles of the United Nations Principles for Sustainable Insurance (“UN PSI”). As a result, we are rolling out these principles throughout our business to align our operations with the UN PSI common framework and integrate ESG criteria into the wider business and into our stakeholder relationships.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (“ESG”)
Subsubsection Text: Under the Innovation pillar, we will continue to develop our understanding of our model’s resilience and the innovation needed within the insurance sector to maintain a leadership position in the industry. It is our aim to collaborate with partners on product development and lifecycle management aspects as well as supporting initiatives to better manage the risks surrounding the physical impacts of climate change, which could have a profound impact on insurability and pricing of certain assets or events, 147 ----- potentially rendering them uninsurable in the long run. In 2023, the Energy team at Price Forbes designed and placed an insurance program to cover the construction of North America’s most technologically advanced re-refiner. The re-refiner will aim to create a sustainable circular model for oil. This technology is pioneering, and the energy team were pivotal in underpinning the success of the project through the design of a comprehensive insurance program that de-risked the construction project for its investors. The ability to aggregate portfolio data is much sought after for brokers and this represents a firm endorsement of the data-powered strategy built by us. In July 2021 we launched a Global Data and Risk Management Centre in Ireland. This management center delivers data-driven insights to our clients worldwide, helping colleagues offer tailored solutions from our offices by providing a highly diversified range of financial services-related products and services across the full value chain and will drive innovation in the global financial services market and help further develop one of the key risk research and development regions in Europe.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (“ESG”)
Subsubsection Text: Under the People pillar, we continue to develop our employee-related practices, including those related to their health and safety, and our initiatives relating to engagement, workforce equity, diversity and inclusion. Fair treatment of our employees and the people we work with is crucial to the future continued successful development of our business and the retention of highly skilled employees. We invest in training and development and, following the COVID-19 pandemic, we have focused our efforts on the mental and physical wellbeing of our employees. We believe in treating all people with respect and dignity. We strive to create and foster a diverse, supportive, inclusive and understanding environment in which all individuals can realize their maximum potential. We are committed to employing the best people to do the best job possible, offering equal opportunities. The diverse capabilities that reside within our talented workforce fulfil the needs of our industry to provide a high-quality service, and we have taken a series of measures to encourage the promotion of diversity throughout our workforce and in senior leadership roles. With respect to engagement, we use a collaboration and communication app called “Engage” to connect all colleagues across the Group. We also set up an internal communication called “Radio Ardonagh” to showcase achievements from across the Group and celebrate the successes of colleagues. We believe all our people should be able to access high quality learning, development, and engagement opportunities, so they can realize their potential and enjoy successful and meaningful careers. Throughout 2023 we have engaged with employees through targeted campaigns that promote subjects relating to the Group’s well-established ED&I forums and wider colleague base. These have focused on issues such as mental health awareness, support for communities through Give Back Week, Pride, International Women’s Day and more. In April 2023, Ardonagh launched its bespoke Carbon Literacy Training Programme, which was created and developed in-house in collaboration with the Carbon Literacy Trust. This program aims to educate our employees on the actions they can take to reduce their carbon footprint and to develop their own business specific projects to create greater climate awareness at a local business level. The program was accredited by the Carbon Literacy Trust in June 2023 and is being rolled out across the wider group via the learning and development team and the Sustainability Champions forum. We work with hundreds of companies across our supply chain, and expect our suppliers to meet high standards in areas such as ethical conduct, human rights, workplace standards and the environment. We have established due diligence processes to help select suppliers who meet these high standards. All our employees are enrolled in our Group’s Diversity, Equality and Inclusion training module as part of their annual training plan. We are working on deploying remuneration strategies to address the gender pay gap. 148 -----

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (“ESG”)
Subsubsection Text: Under the Society pillar, we aim to cover aspects of our business in relation to human rights and community relations, customer privacy, data security, access and affordability, and selling practices and product labelling. Treating customers fairly and looking after vulnerable customers have been industrywide priorities, particularly as millions of customers have tipped into ‘low financial resilience’. Poor numeracy skills are seen as a big driver for these difficulties. Research, published in July 2021, found that Plain Number versions of the same customer insurance documents, such as explanations of excess or premium finance costs, doubled levels of understanding on average. Across five trials, customers seeing the Plain Numbers versions were nearly twice as likely to be able to answer four out of five comprehension questions correctly, thereby enabling them to make better decisions.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (“ESG”)
Subsubsection Text: We are looking to play a more critical role in combating the climate crisis by better understanding, managing and monitoring our greenhouse gas emissions, energy and water use as well as our waste and ecological impact. We recognize that we have a responsibility to the environment and we endeavor to be as environmentally friendly as possible in our business activities. We are committed to becoming net zero and have developed a comprehensive environmental management program to guide our efforts in our UK businesses. We continue to manage our waste and use of natural resources, and our consumption of renewable energy is monitored. The below chart shows a breakdown of our greenhouse gas emissions from UK operations in 2021 and 2022.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (“ESG”)
Subsubsection Text: We strive to be a responsible industry presence seeking to contribute positively to society, industry developments and the environment. We believe that a responsible approach to our employees, partners, local communities, the environment and society in general is an essential part of our wider and longerterm success.
